Cabinet today has approved The Online Safety and Media Regulation Bill, a set of new proposed laws that move us from an era of self regulation to where platforms will be held to account over online safety. https://t.co/ZGqguzUoeJ
This Bill incorporates the majority of the 33 recommendations put forward by the Joint Oireachtas Committee for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Sport and Media.

The recommendation for an individual complaints mechanism for harmful online content, raises complex issues and requires further consideration.  I'm setting up an expert group this month to report to me, which I may use as the basis for an amendment to the Bill.

I will now look to establish Coimisi√∫n na Me√°n (Media Commission) on an administrative basis prior to the enactment of the Bill and begin recruiting for roles, including the Online Safety Commissioner.

Commuters going through #Sandyford,  I was disappointed to learn of the reduction of @GoAheadIreland's 75/75a route & had written to the organisation to ask for its restoration. https://t.co/Zx17Ks22mf https://t.co/UA6f6QSGtw

Today I've received confirmation from @GoAheadIreland that they're working on a plan to reinstate the route for the afternoon and I'm pleased to confirm they are running a 75A 5:55pm departure from Dun Laoghaire, Mon - Fri.

This route is not on the timetable but will be reflected on the Real Time Passenger Information at stops.  Public transport must be a reliable option for people, particularly people planning daily commutes.
My team will continue to liaise with Go Ahead Ireland on the full restoration of all services on this route.
